newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish BRE next eurobond issue in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Polish BRE next eurobond issue in 1997.

text.p: Bank Rozwoju Exportu SA (BRE) has scrapped plans to stage a second eurobond issue in 1996, but will return to international fiancial markets next year with another dollar-denominated bond offer, its president said.
"We will not hold any more issues in 1996, but we will issue more dollar-denominated eurobonds in 1997," Krzysztof Szwarc told Reuters on Wednesday.
BRE, Poland's 15th largest bank, earlier said it would announce a $100 million eurobond issue in September priced at less than 85 basis points above LIBOR.
BRE issued Poland's first ever corporate eurobond in April, a successfull launch of a $50 million three-year bond at 100 bp above LIBOR. -- Wojciech Moskwa +48 22 653 9700
